body.p:
To His Excellency Beriah Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky

Your Petitioner William McKaye -- respectfully states that at the January Term (1861) of the city court of Louisville he was fined fifty dollars for carrying concealed a pistol He confessed Judgment. He states that the pistol was found on his person, during the Christmas holidays -- that he is not in the habit of carrying concealed weapons, and that no person was injured by reason of his carrying the weapon, and that he did not attempt to hyrm any person with it. He states that he got the same from his house, and loaded it with powder only and fired it off -- as hundreds of other youngsters were doing at the same time in the city, celebrating Christmas -- and a policemen not friendly with him took it from him, and he was fined. He has paid $15 75. The costs in the prosecution, and that is all he his able to pay -- He respectfully, asks your Excellency to remit said fine & he will ever pray & --

The petitioner Wm McKaye is a young man, we know him well, and believe that a fine should not have been assessed against him under with the circumstances as stated in his petition & ask for a remission of the fine.

Isham Talbot
